docs.title: A python toolbox making open-borders metrics easier !
One-liner CLI
docs.text:
If you just want a CSV/JSON/Excel file with the metrics, don't bother, just go

opbd preprocess -n -o open-borders-index.csv
  • -n means normalize actross countries
  • -o means output to file, extension is detected (.csv|.xlsx|.json)

docs.title: Credits
docs.text:
This toolbox heavily relies on the work from the folks at wbdata and overall APIs of international organisations:

  • World Bank API
  • World Bank's GDIM which is the Global Database on Intergenerational Mobility

docs.title: Command-Line Interface openborders
docs.text:
A small toolbox to make open-borders metrics using World Bank (& ILO) data.

Usage:

$ openborders [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options:

  • --install-completion: Install completion for the current shell.
  • --show-completion: Show completion for the current shell, to copy it or customize the installation.
  • --help: Show this message and exit.

Commands:

  • empty: Wipe existing cached information if it...
  • load: Load data from World Bank & GDIM to be...
  • preprocess: Preprocess loaded data from World Bank &...
  • reset: Wipe existing cached information if it...
  • rm: Wipe existing cached information if it...
  • show: Show loaded data from World Bank & GDIM to...
  • wipe: Wipe existing cached information if it...

docs.title: Emptying cache openborders empty
docs.text:
Wipe existing cached information if it exists. Alias for reset.

Usage:

$ openborders empty [OPTIONS]

Options:

  • --help: Show this message and exit.

docs.title: openborders preprocess
docs.text:
Preprocess loaded data from World Bank & GDIM to be used subsequently.

Usage:

$ openborders preprocess [OPTIONS]

Options:

  • -i, --indicator TEXT: Filter the view on an indicator
  • -li, --list-indicators: List available indicators
  • -ygt, --year-greater INTEGER: Whether to filter on years greater than {value} [default: 1980]
  • -dna, --drop-na: Whether to drop NA values.
  • -n, --norm: Whether to scale every metric to [0,1] using the per-country
  • -o, --outfile TEXT: Output the result as a flat file. (Formats: .csv, .xlsx, .json)
  • -d, --debug: Debug using log statements at each inner loop operation.
  • --help: Show this message and exit.

docs.title: openborders show
docs.text:
Show loaded data from World Bank & GDIM to be used subsequently.

Usage:

$ openborders show [OPTIONS]

Options:

  • -i, --indicator TEXT: Filter the view on an indicator
  • -li, --list-indicators: List available indicators
  • -pp, --pre-process: Whether to preprocess the raw cache data & display the results of the aggregation instead.
  • -ygt, --year-greater INTEGER: Whether to filter on years greater than {value} [default: 1990]
  • -o, --outfile TEXT: Output the result as a flat file. (Formats: .csv, .xlsx, .json)
  • -d, --desc: Add description column to the resulting table.
  • --help: Show this message and exit.

docs.title: openborders wipe
docs.text:

Usage:

$ openborders wipe [OPTIONS]

Options:

  • --help: Show this message and exit.

docs.title: .preprocess
docs.text:
source

.preprocess(
   cls, dropna: bool = True, list_indicators: bool = False, indicator: str = None,
   normalize: bool = True, year_gt: int = 1980, debug: bool = False
)

Preprocesses the merged dataframe by grouping the metrics per batches of 5 years, and normalizes the values across countries on that time period.

Args

  • dropna (bool, optional) : Whether to drop NA rows. Defaults to True.
  • list_indicators (bool, optional) : Whether to just list indicators instead of pre-processing. Defaults to False.
  • indicator (str, optional) : Whether to filter on a specific indicator before pre-processing. Defaults to None.
  • normalize (bool, optional) : Whether to perform cross-country normalization of the metrics. Defaults to True.
  • year_gt (int, optional) : Whether to drop years before a certain date. Defaults to 1980, dropping all years before that date.
  • debug (bool, optional) : Whether to log additionnal information, verbosity level. Defaults to False.

Returns

  • str : A preprocessed pd.DataFrame ready for use (storage | plotting | ranking)
